sentence.text: Fortunately a lorry driver was washing in the basin , so while he went off to have a shit in one of the cabinets , I rifled his spongebag and pinched a disposable razor .
Stephen pinched half the slice from her plate .
Werewolf leaned over and pinched a Sweet Afton from the packet on the table in front of me .
Somebody pinched something off me so , Bugger all this , I said , I left her there .
The problem about the word communitarianism is that the French have pinched it .
` Well , if your managing director is such a hot-shot , you 'd better watch out that he does n't want to pinch your job ! "
The new wave of theft means more than £3,800 worth of goods are pinched every minute .
` The divine right of kings does n't mean you can pinch my soap , " Fairbrother had snarled , and the three other boys in the wash room had been electrified by such dazzling insolence .
He found that the plastic namebar on his mailbox kept being pinched by fans , so he bought a hand label machine to replace it daily .
All the houses had tiny yards but most of the gates had been pinched and the whole place was full of rubble .
They looked like they could have been pinched from a golf course .
Well , do n't come screaming to me next time one of the local hippies pinches a load of your acid off you .
And the lads used to go and pinch out of the girls ' bags .
It was a battery which Toss had pinched for him from a temporary traffic-light .
` He pinched them off you , did n't he ? "
Lee 's hid some gunpowder he swiped from under the Arches and I 'm gon na pinch it off him . "
Sorneone saw the open garage door and sneaked in to see what he could pinch .
